alert.note: Alert for Pickens; Tuscaloosa (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 18 at 9:24PM CDT until June 19 at 8:00AM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM CDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of central Alabama, including the following counties, Autauga, Bibb, Chilton, Dallas, Elmore, Greene, Hale, Lowndes, Marengo, Montgomery, Perry, Pickens, Sumter and Tuscaloosa. * WHEN...Until 7 AM CDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - An additional 1 to 2 inches of rain is expected this evening and into the overnight hours on top of saturated soils in place. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
